glsa.title: libvorbis: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: A processing error in libvorbis might result in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

background.p: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.

description.p: Lucas Adamski reported that libvorbis does not correctly process file headers, related to static mode headers and encoding books.

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to play a specially crafted OGG Vorbis file using an application that uses libvorbis, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
